abstract: In 1898, Ernest Duporcq stated a famous theorem about rigid-body motions with spherical trajectories, without giving a rigorous proof. Today, this theorem is again of interest, as it is strongly connected with the topic of self-motions of planar Stewart-Gough platforms. We discuss Duporcq's theorem from this point of view and demonstrate that it is not correct. Moreover, we also present a revised version of this theorem. © 2013 The Author.

author_highlights.sentence: We study the connection between Duporcq’s theorem and architecture singularity.
Based on this point of view, we demonstrate that Duporcq’s theorem is not correct.
Moreover, we present a revised version of Duporcq’s theorem.
